Choices: a: A branch of AI that focuses on enabling computers to learn from data and make predictions or decisions without being explicitly programmed. | b: A type of AI that uses neural networks to perform tasks such as image recognition and speech processing. | c: A type of AI that uses natural language processing to perform tasks such as chatbots and language translation.
Correct: A branch of AI that focuses on enabling computers to learn from data and make predictions or decisions without being explicitly programmed.

MCQ: What are the three main types of machine learning?
Choices: a: Supervised learning, unsupervised learning, and reinforcement learning. | b: Deep learning, transfer learning, and one-shot learning. | c: Unsupervised learning, supervised learning, and semi-supervised learning.
Correct: Supervised learning, unsupervised learning, and reinforcement learning.

MCQ: What is the typical machine learning workflow?
Choices: a: Collecting and preprocessing data, training a model using an appropriate algorithm, testing the model on unseen data, and deploying the model into real-world applications. | b: Data collection, feature engineering, model selection, training, validation, and deployment. | c: Data preprocessing, model selection, training, validation, and deployment.
Correct: Collecting and preprocessing data, training a model using an appropriate algorithm, testing the model on unseen data, and deploying the model into real-world applications.
